channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: I have lost 2 tyres to Cheltenham potholes in six weeks (£500!) and this one is deeper and more dangerous than any I’ve seen., 21st December
item.description:
It’s just by the pedestrian crossing by the rear exit to Cheltenham Spa railway station, heading IN to the town centre

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 259, Gloucester Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes on mini roundabout, 20th December
item.description:
On mini roundabout by community centre and council office
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes remain by bus stop despite being told they had been fixed, 20th December
item.description:
Unfortunately potholes getting worse. Update to report said they has been fixed. No work has been carried out at all. Terrible road conditions. Even pavement vibrates. Located by bus stop outside 185 - 187 Gloucester Road. Needs urgent repair work.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 185, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes on Glenfall way, 20th December
item.description:
There are quite a few potholes at the junction from Lawrence Close turning right onto Glenfall Way. The photograph attached is one of many on Glenfall Way

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glenfall Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyt ipping, 20th December
item.description:
Yet more rubbish dumped by the tree. This is a constant issue.This area has been a hot spot for fly tipping for years. Makes the area look awful.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Pates Avenue, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree on verge blocking PROW., 20th December
item.description:
Southam Lane near to Kayte Lane. This has been reported before and closed. But the tree is still there and needs removing. Please provide an update before closing again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Utility trench sunken into highway, 20th December
item.description:
Approximately 25m back from the entrance to the Mira site. The nearside end of the trench is deeper and causes a banging when the car wheels go over it. Issue has been there for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Cromwell Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Low drain cover, 20th December
item.description:
Just as you go around bend towards the town.

item.title: Blocked drain flooding, 20th December
item.description:
The drain outside St Andrews Church, Churchdown is blocked . So are other drains nearby which results in a flood every time it rains. Surplus water flows across the road and down Sation Road. I'm surprised since it has been reported several times before now, over months or year ,that it has not been resolved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 20th December
item.description:
Customer reports a pothole at the location which has damaged their vehicle; they believe that it was previously attended to by Highways but has reopened. It is around 2ft by 1ft and 3-4" in depth.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 20th December
item.description:
28 day with give an take plus 15 minutes delay boards needed carriageway pothole 600x600x40mm tarmac patch required please number 1 best out of hours (CW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -other CW10 problem, 20th December
item.description:
Carriage Rutting and Deptession 2 m x 1 m x 70mm Possible Sinkhole NWD / road closure adv Job was raised on 12 11 24 for a 4metre square Some of the patch has failed and the depth has gone from 55mm to over 70mm. A cone was left on but not sure whether it was Ringway or member of public. (CW10 Rutting&Depressions)
Report on FixMyStreet
